p: Starch has been also blended with antimicrobial polymers to provide a bioactive character. Chitin nanowhiskers were added (0.5â€“5%) to starch, and films obtained by solvent casting were tested against L. monocytogenes and E. coli to analyze their antibacterial properties [ 167]. These films showed more effectiveness against Gram-positive than against Gram-negative bacteria. Moreover, they exhibited improved thermal properties and mechanical strength in comparison to native maize starch.
